docs.snippet: The government says it is looking at banning virtual currency trades. But it isn’t clear whether, or how quickly, it will follow through.

headline.print_headline: A Ban on Bitcoin? Why South Korea Is Spooking a Global Currency Market
headline.main: Why Is South Korea Spooking the Global Bitcoin Market?

docs.snippet: Boneless fillets are excellent steamed: The technique is easy to master, and aromatics — like ginger, scallions and sesame oil — are readily available.
Doctoring up a jar of red curry paste makes for a deeply flavored noodle dish.

headline.print_headline: Ssshh! That Thai Dish Secret Started in a Jar
headline.main: The Secret to Better Thai Dishes May Already Be in Your Fridge

docs.snippet: The civil rights leader was stabbed, honored and given a student pastoral assignment. He also led one of his biggest marches, against the war.

headline.main: What Martin Luther King Jr. Meant to New York

docs.abstract: The civil rights leader was stabbed, honored and given a student pastoral assignment. He also led one of his biggest marches, against the war.

docs.snippet: Mr. Clarke was the last surviving member of the British rock band’s best-known lineup.

headline.main: Fast Eddie Clarke, Motörhead Guitarist, Dies at 67

docs.snippet: Oyub Titiev, who has run a human rights group since the unsolved murder of a member of the group, is the latest in a series of government critics to face drug charges.

headline.print_headline: Chechen Arrest Reflects  Crackdown, Activists Say
headline.main: Arrest in Chechnya Reflects Effort to Drive Out Dissidents, Activists Say

docs.snippet: The push by two investment funds to have Apple give parents better controls over their children’s iPhones shows Silicon Valley has lost its exalted status.

headline.main: Tech Backlash Catches Up to Apple

docs.snippet: The attack was directed against Russian targets in Syria, with militants there launching 13 armed drones against naval and air bases.

headline.main: Russia Says Its Syria Bases Beat Back an Attack by 13 Drones

docs.snippet: Two Times technology reporters discuss the goings-on of Silicon Valley and beyond. This week: The year kicks off with a nightmare computer bug and increased scrutiny of YouTube.

headline.print_headline: Security Flaws and Social Media Outrages
headline.main: Farhad and Mike’s Week in Tech: Another Huge Security Flaw

docs.snippet: Teachers say students have had to attend class in hats, coats and gloves. Public school officials said they are addressing problems at old buildings as they arise.

headline.print_headline: Baltimore City Schools Are Without Heat, Prompting Protests From Teachers and Parents
headline.main: Baltimore City Schools Are Without Heat, Prompting Protests From Teachers and Parents
